definition: to be able to endure (exertion, fatigue etc)/to be able to afford
variant of 吃[chi1]
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need
to be unable to tolerate or endure/to find sth difficult to manage
to be able to bear/to be able to support
to collapse/to be worn out/to break down
to refrain/to be able to endure it
posture/upright posture
to be unable to stand
to become exhausted
unbearable/terrible/enough/unlikely
to bear/to enjoy (usually in negative combination, meaning unable to enjoy)
tired to the point of dropping
made of iron/strong as iron
to toss from side to side (e.g. sleeplessly)/to repeat sth over and over again/to torment sb/to play crazy/to squander (time, money)
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
it'd be a wonder if... (following a verb phrase that is usually negative)
erhua variant of 身板[shen1 ban3]
